title: Receiving & Shipping
description: Requirements for receiving and shipping operations including trailer sanitation checks, incoming goods inspection, pest inspections, temperature controls, and dock equipment maintenance

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for checking sanitary condition of truck trailers prior to unloading?
mandatoryStatements: Documented procedure exists for trailer sanitation checks before unloading
Procedure specifies what to inspect (cleanliness, odors, damage, pests)
Procedure defines acceptance criteria for trailer sanitation
Procedure identifies who is responsible for inspection
Procedure includes rejection criteria and response
Procedure requires documentation of inspection results
Personnel are trained on trailer inspection procedure
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of trailer inspection procedure, quarterly verification that procedure is followed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Pre-unloading inspection performed for every incoming trailer, documentation completed immediately

requirements.text: Are there inspection records for incoming goods (e.g., seeds, transplants, growing media, packing materials)?
mandatoryStatements: Inspection records are maintained for all incoming goods
Records document inspection of seeds, transplants, growing media
Records document inspection of packaging materials
Inspection includes verification of quality and condition
Records show date, inspector, supplier, and inspection results
Non-conforming goods are documented and segregated
Records support traceability of incoming materials
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of incoming goods inspection records for completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Inspection performed and documented for each incoming shipment

requirements.text: Are there inspection logs on incoming trailers (and other forms of transport) for rodents and insects, cleanliness, holes and/or as required per buyer specifications)?
mandatoryStatements: Inspection logs are maintained for all incoming trailers and transport
Logs document inspection for rodents and rodent evidence
Logs document inspection for insects and insect evidence
Logs document trailer cleanliness assessment
Logs document inspection for holes or damage
Logs include buyer-specified inspection criteria if applicable
Trailers failing inspection are rejected or corrected before unloading
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of trailer inspection logs for completeness and proper follow-up
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Every incoming trailer inspected and logged before unloading

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for checking truck trailer temperature and reviewing sanitary condition of truck trailers prior to loading?
mandatoryStatements: Documented procedure exists for trailer checks before loading
Procedure requires temperature verification for refrigerated loads
Procedure specifies sanitary condition inspection requirements
Procedure defines acceptance criteria for trailers
Procedure identifies responsible person for inspection
Procedure includes rejection criteria and alternative actions
Personnel are trained on pre-loading inspection procedure
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of pre-loading inspection procedure, quarterly verification of compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Pre-loading inspection performed for every outgoing shipment

requirements.text: Are there records of shipping truck trailer (or other transportation systems) temperature and sanitary condition checks?
mandatoryStatements: Records are maintained for all outgoing trailer inspections
Records document trailer temperature at loading (for temp-controlled)
Records document sanitary condition inspection results
Records show date, inspector, carrier, and inspection findings
Records link to specific shipments/loads
Non-conforming trailers are documented with corrective actions
Records demonstrate consistent inspection practice
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of shipping trailer inspection records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Inspection and documentation completed for each outgoing shipment

requirements.text: Are shipping trucks clean and in good condition?
mandatoryStatements: Shipping trucks and trailers are visibly clean
No dirt, debris, or contamination in cargo areas
Trucks are in good physical condition without damage
No holes, tears, or openings that could allow contamination
No odors or evidence of previous incompatible loads
Refrigeration equipment functional (if applicable)
Trucks meet facility acceptance standards
requirements.verificationExpectations: Pre-loading inspection verifies truck cleanliness and condition
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Visual inspection of every truck before loading, rejection if not acceptable

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for checking sanitary condition of truck trailers prior to unloading?
mandatoryStatements: This appears to be a duplicate of 3.07.01
Same requirements as 3.07.01 apply

requirements.text: Are dock load levelers and buffers/shelters maintained in good condition, pest proof and debris free?
mandatoryStatements: Dock load levelers are maintained in good operating condition
Dock buffers and shelters are in good repair
Dock equipment is pest-proof (no gaps for pest entry)
Dock area is kept free of debris and accumulation
Regular inspection and maintenance of dock equipment
Dock equipment does not present contamination risk
Dock area cleanliness supports sanitary operations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of dock equipment condition and cleanliness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly checks of dock area, immediate cleanup of debris

capaInject: If trailer inspection procedure not documented: develop procedure within 7 days, implement immediately
If incoming goods inspection records not maintained: implement inspection log immediately, retroactive documentation where possible
If trailer found with pests or unsanitary conditions: reject trailer, do not unload, find alternative transport
If pre-loading inspection not performed: immediate implementation, halt loading until inspection completed
If shipping records incomplete: immediate completion of records, implement verification process
If truck not clean or in poor condition: reject truck, delay loading until acceptable truck available
If dock equipment in poor condition: immediate repair, temporary measures to prevent pest entry or contamination
traceabilityInject: Incoming trailer inspection records must be traceable to specific shipments and received materials
Incoming goods inspection records must link to specific lots and storage locations
Outgoing trailer inspection records must be traceable to specific shipments and customers
Temperature records must be traceable to specific loads and trailers
